value.value: A spatial transcriptomics assay that involves physically expanding specimens with polymer- and hydrogel-based systems followed by in situ sequencing.

A spatial transcriptomics assay that involves physically expanding specimens with polymer- and hydrogel-based systems followed by targeted padlock probe hybridization, amplification, and in situ sequencing of padlock barcode.

A spatial transcriptomics assay that involves physically expanding specimens with polymer- and hydrogel-based systems followed by reverse transcription, amplification, and in situ sequencing of untargeted RNA using FISSEQ.
A surgical technique used by medical professionals to extract mature eggs directly from an ovary with the guidance of ultrasound imaging.

A droplet-based microfluidic library construction platform based on inDrop that incorporates dual-indexing to detect index-hopping and standard Illumina sequencing primers for high-throughput sequencing.
A microwell-based technology developed by Singleron to prepare mRNA from single cells or single nuclei and generate a next generation sequencing (NGS) library for high-throughput sequencing.
The library preparation step of a spatial transcriptomics assay.
A saliva collection method where a solution such as a saline solution or other solution is used to rinse the mouth before collection of saliva.

The collective capabilities of CITE-seq and Cell Hashing adapted for compatibility with the 5P / V(D)J single cell kit from 10x Genomics, to allow researchers to perform sample multiplexing, doublet detection and protein detection together with 5’ gene expression and V(D)J reconstruction.

Through the addition of a custom RT primer and additional PCR reactions on the low molecular weight cDNA fraction, sgRNA capture and single cell CRISPR screens with multimodal readout are made possible.
The PacBio Sequel II system is a high-throughput, long-read sequencing machine developed by PacBio.

Library construction method using SMART (Switching Mechanism at the 5' end of the RNA Template) to generate high-quality cDNA from ultra-low amounts of total RNA or directly from multiple intact cells (<1,000 cells). Smart-seq v4 improves upon the Smart-seq2 method by incorporating both the novel use of locked nucleic acid (LNA) technology and an optimized template switching oligo.

label.value: pseudo-bulk aggregation of single-cell ATAC-seq data

value.value: A processed matrix generation method that involves combining (binary or quantitative) single-cell ATAC seq data from multiple cells within the same biological sample and/or cell types, depending on the intended downstream values. Ideally, aggregation is done within predefined regions of the genome e.g., using called peaks or tiles across the genome. The aggregated profiles can then be used in the same manner as bulk ATAC-seq or DNase-seq data.
An example of an applied case of pseduo-bulk scATAC-seq data to facilitate comparisons between traditional DNase/ATAC data and single-cell studies: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29539636.

A next-generation sequencing (NGS) sequencer from Beijing Genomics Institute (BGI) based on DNA nanoball (DNB) and probe-anchor synthesis (cPAS) technology, which were also used in the previous version of the BGISEQ-500 device; however, the reagents for MGISEQ-2000 have been refined and the platform utilizes updated software.
The ONT PromethION 2 Solo is a compact modular sequencing unit developed by Oxford Nanopore Technologies that can run up to two PromethION flow cells and connect to ONT GridION Mk1 devices.

Each flow cell of the ONT PromethION 2 Solo is independently addressable, meaning that experiments can be run concurrently or individually. The PromethION 2 Solo plugs into a GridION Mk1 or user compute for real-time data streaming and analysis.

Birt-Hogg-Dube (BHD) syndrome is characterized by skin lesions, kidney tumors, and pulmonary cysts that may be associated with pneumothorax. It is a rare clinicopathologic condition named after the three Canadian physicians who reported the syndrome in 1977.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Autosomal recessive form of Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Lysosomal acid lipase deficiency is a lipid storage disease that can result in 1) an early-onset severe form, Wolman disease, or 2) a less severe form, cholesteryl ester storage disease, of cholesteryl ester accumulation in the body (liver, spleen, macrophages). Wolman disease is characterized by neonatal abdominal distension, major or even massive hepatosplenomegaly and calcified adrenal glands, cholesteryl ester storage disease presents with microvesicular steatosis leading to hepatomegaly and hypercholesterolaemia with subsequent liver failure and accelerated atherosclerosis.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: bleeding diathesis due to thromboxane synthesis deficiency

value.value: A rare, genetic, isolated constitutional thrombocytopenia disease characterized by impaired platelet aggregation resulting from a defect in thromboxane synthesis or signaling, manifesting with mild to moderate mucocutaneous, gastrointestinal or surgical bleeding (e.g. easy bruising, prolonged epistaxis, excessive bleeding after a tooth extraction).

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: familial mesial temporal lobe epilepsy with febrile seizures

value.value: A rare, genetic, familial partial epilepsy disease characterized by simple partial seizures, complex partial seizures and/or secondarily generalized seizures, originating from the inner aspect of the temporal lobe, associated with an antecedant history of febrile seizures, ocurring in various members of a family. Hippocampal abnormalities (e.g. hippocampal sclerosis) may also be associated.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: A rare hereditary optic atrophy characterized by an early onset of bilateral optic nerve degeneration without other systemic features. Clinical manifestations include pallor of the optic disks, severe but slowly progressing visual impairment, and in some patients also paracentral scotoma, photophobia and dyschromatopsia.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Autosomal dominant form of pure hereditary spastic paraplegia.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Autosomal recessive form of complex hereditary spastic paraplegia.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.
A class of gastroenterological diseases involving the stomch and or esophagus.
Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: An inflammatory disease involving a pathogenic inflammatory response in the brain.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Anorectal malformations (ARMs) represent a complex group of congenital anomalies resulting from abnormal development of the hindgut, allantois and Mullerian duct resulting in complete or partial urorectal septal malformations. 50 % of cases are syndromic although many may have other associated anomalies.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: autosomal dominant hereditary axonal motor and sensory neuropathy

value.value: A form of axonal hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy with autosomal dominant inheritance.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: autosomal recessive hereditary demyelinating motor and sensory neuropathy

value.value: A form of demyelinating hereditary motor and sensory neuropathies (HMSN) with autosomal recessive inheritance. HMSNs are a group of inherited progressive neuropathies with markedly decreased nerve conduction velocity and chronic segmental demyelination in the peripheral nerve.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: autosomal dominant hereditary sensory and autonomic neuropathy

value.value: A form of hereditary sensory autonomic neuropathy (HSAN) with autosomal dominant inheritance. HSANs are a group of rare peripheral neuropathies where neurons and/or axons are affected. The major feature of these conditions is the loss of large myelinated and unmyelinated fibers.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: autosomal recessive hereditary sensory and autonomic neuropathy

value.value: A form of hereditary sensory autonomic neuropathy (HSAN) with autosomal recessive inheritance. HSANs are a group of rare peripheral neuropathies where neurons and/or axons are affected. The major feature of these conditions is the loss of large myelinated and unmyelinated fibers.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Lateral facial clefting (macrostomia) is a rare congenital malformation. It may occur either as an isolated phenomenon or in combination with other congenital anomalies.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Familial isolated dilated cardiomyopathy is a rare, genetically heterogeneous cardiac disease characterized by dilatation leading to systolic and diastolic dysfunction of the left and/or right ventricles, causing heart failure or arrhythmia.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: benign familial mesial temporal lobe epilepsy

value.value: Benign familial mesial temporal lobe epilepsy is a rare epilepsy characterized by seizures with viscerosensory or experential auras, onset in adolescence or early adulthood and good prognosis. It is defined as at least 24 months of seizure freedom with or without antiepileptic medication.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: A form of hereditary thrombocytopenia with normal platelets.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Congenital myopathies represent a clinically and genetically heterogeneous group of early-onset neuromuscular diseases with characteristic, but not always specific, histopathological features, often presenting with stable and/or slowly progressive truncal and proximal weakness. The “core myopathies” collectively represent the most common form of congenital myopathies, and the name pathologically corresponds to histochemical appearance of focally reduced oxidative enzyme activity and myofibrillar changes on ultrastructural studies.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Some forms of congenital hypothyroidism associated with defects in other organ systems are classified as syndromic hypothyroidism. These include Pendred syndrome, Bamforth-Lazarus syndrome and Kocher - Deber - Semilange syndrome.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.
An instance of neutropenia that is acquired during the lifetime of the individual.
Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: primary immunodeficiency due to a defect in adaptive immunity

value.value: Disorders of adaptive immunity (i.e., T-cell, B-cell or combined immunodeficiencies), a type of primary immunodeficiency disorder (PID), which constitute a heterogeneous group of disorders that result from defects in immune system development and/or function.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Cerebellar malformations are diverse congenital anomalies frequently associated with developmental disability.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Developmental and epileptic encephalopathy-1 (DEE1) is a severe form of epilepsy characterized by frequent tonic seizures or spasms beginning in infancy. DEE1 is caused by mutation in the ARX gene.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Disorders of the developing brain that constitute a wide variety of complex malformations that account for a significant fraction of childhood onset epilepsy, intellectual disability, and autism.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Myotonia congenita (MC) is a genetic neuromuscular channelopathy which usually presents in early childhood resulting in a delay of skeletal muscle relaxation following contraction.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: qualitative or quantitative defects of merosin

value.value: Defects in merosin proteins, a group of laminins that share the alpha2 subunit encoded by the LAMA2 gene. Laminins are a family of high molecular weight glycoproteins that function as extracellular matrix components of the structural basement membrane.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: qualitative or quantitative defects of calpain

value.value: Defects in calpain protein, an intracellular protease that requires calcium for its catalytic activity.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: qualitative or quantitative defects of myotubularin

value.value: Defects in myotubularin, a protein required for muscle cell differentiation.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Chronic form of acquired peripheral neuropathy.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

label.value: autosomal dominant proximal spinal muscular atrophy

value.value: A group of rare, genetic, motor neuron disease characterized by childhood or adult onset progressive, predominantly proximal, muscular weakness and wasting. Included diseases are Autosomal dominant adult-onset proximal spinal muscular atrophy, Lower motor neuron syndrome with late-adult onset, and Autosomal dominant childhood-onset proximal spinal muscular atrophy.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Semilobar holoprosencephaly is one of the classical forms of holoprosencephaly (HPE) in which the left and right frontal and parietal lobes are fused and the interhemispheric fissure is only present posteriorly.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Primary congenital hypothyroidism is a type of permanent congenital hypothyroidism, a permanent thyroid hormone deficiency that is present from birth.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: Klippel-Feil Syndrome is characterised by improper segmentation of cervical segments resulting in congenitally fused cervical vertebrae.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.

value.value: A rare combined T and B cell immunodeficiency with a predisposition to lymphoproliferative syndrome. It is characterized by persistent symptomatic EBV-viremia and hypogammaglobulinemia variably presenting with fever, lymphadenopathy and systemic inflammatory conditions including hepatitis, pneumonia and sepsis. It may be associated with lymphoma, hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis, and aplastic anemia.

definition.value: Term added in response to Mondo restructuring. To be considered for replacement or obsoletion in EFO also.
